meanings.definition: A first or preliminary model of something, from which other forms are developed or copied.
meanings.sent1: The toy car he made was a prototype of the real car.
meanings.sent2: The prototype of the new phone was tested extensively before production.
meanings.sent3: The prototype of the cake she baked looked more like a pancake.
meanings.sent4: Her painting was a prototype of emotions, capturing raw feelings on canvas.
meanings.sent5: The prototype of the robot was so lifelike, it seemed almost human.

meanings.definition: An original type, form, or instance serving as a basis or standard for later stages.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scroll was a prototype of written language.
meanings.sent2: The prototype of the new software set a high standard for efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The prototype of the treehouse was more like a bird's nest.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a prototype of inspiration, motivating the audience to action.
meanings.sent5: The prototype of the flower was so vibrant, it stood out among the rest.
